description: From show +â€Ž room. Verb sense circa 2011.

entries.meaning: A room in a business set aside for the display of the company's products.
(dated) A room or apartment where a show is exhibited.

verbs.description: showroom (third-person singular simple present showrooms, present participle showrooming, simple past and past participle showroomed)

entries.meaning: To inspect merchandise in a physical store, then purchase the identical product from an online merchant; to use a physical store as a showroom for an online merchant.
examples: This new phone looks good, but I want to go to the mall and showroom it before buying.
